question: Which among the following is a character of Chloroplast which makes them qualified to self replication?
explanation: Presence of Both DNA & RNA in Chloroplast makes them qualified to self-replication. Chloroplasts, like mitochondria, contain their own DNA. This DNA is inherited from their ancestorâ€”a photosynthetic cyanobacterium that was engulfed by an early eukaryotic cell.
